roleset.name: record charges, fees or records
roleset.note: BOOK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'book' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry get 13.5.1, but I don't see the connection. No comparison. (from book.01-v predicate notes)

role.descr: criminal, person or value being booked
crime, what you are booked for or as

example.text: Christopher Blair Labat , 24 , was booked *-1 Tuesday on one count of aggravated assault
example.arg: on one count of aggravated assault

example.text: He was booked for DUI on Friday night in Beverly Hills.

example.name: Charges
example.text: Some analysts hedge their estimates for Quantum, because it isn't known when the company will book certain one-time charges.
If it had been a Chelsea player that was booked for diving there would be outrage

roleset.name: schedule (perhaps fully); purchase a ticker or appointment
roleset.note: BOOK-V NOTES: Added for unification (from book.03-v)
BOOKED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from booked.01-j)

role.descr: booking agent, if different from arg0

example.name: arg2
example.text: Wow ! Cool . Sorry you have to wait but I guess it 's good I 'm booked !

example.name: args3 and 1
example.text: I doubt it 's me ! :-RRB- It 's probably booked with returning patients . :-RRB-

example.name: arg5
example.text: We 've booked Italy tickets for next October

example.name: booking agent
example.text: The one time 0 I actually booked through a travel agent

example.name: passive
example.text: Peter Otradovec, vice president for planning at the Phoenix, Ariz., carrier, said in an interview that the work stoppage at Boeing, now entering its 13th day, ``has caused some turmoil in our scheduling '' and that more than 500 passengers who [*T*] were booked to fly out of Houston on America West would now be put on other airlines.
example.arg: to fly out of Houston on America West

example.name: Hotels
example.text: [All hotels in the 10-mile radius from San Jose]-1 have been booked *-1 up.
